measured_by: 7-point valence scale (1 = “very good news” to 7 = “very bad news”)
justification: “Participants were asked to assess their opinions of the current predictions on a scale from 1 ("very good news") to 7 ("very bad news"), along with several other questions.”

measured_by: Absolute distance from midpoint of the 7-point scale
justification: “we coded the extremity of rated attitudes as the absolute difference from the midpoint of the scale (extremity = |rating – 4|).”

measured_by: Amount of $5 endowment wagered in betting task
justification: “Before finding out if they had won, they could choose to bet as much of the potential $5 as they wished on the team more likely to win… Participants then allocated the $5 between betting on the team predicted to win and not betting.”
construct: Willingness to bet on favored team

measured_by: Participant-generated estimates of equivalent margin (vote share / point-spread / marble count)
justification: “In the chance-forecast-display condition, they saw a chance forecast … and were asked to estimate the corresponding margin forecast for each candidate.”

measured_by: Participant-generated estimates of equivalent chance (probability of winning / majority)
justification: “In the margin-forecast-display condition, they saw the predicted vote-margin … and were asked to estimate the corresponding chance forecast for each candidate.”
